abstract: Santiago Taveras, former deputy schools chancellor under Mayor Michael Bloomberg who tried to save DeWitt Clinton High School in Bronx from closing by taking pay cut and becoming its principal, is removed after Education Dept investigation finds he changed course codes or grades and forced assistant principal to resign by threatening poor rating; remains unclear whether Taveras will be fired or demoted.
lead_paragraph: Santiago Taveras, of DeWitt Clinton High School, joins a list of principals tasked with turning around troubled schools, only to leave or be forced out after Education Department inquiries.
snippet: Santiago Taveras, of DeWitt Clinton High School, joins a list of principals tasked with turning around troubled schools, only to leave or be forced out after Education Department inquiries....

headline.main: Pushing for Change, Bronx Principal Is Undone by Investigation
headline.print_headline: Principal Who Tried to Save School Is Undone by Inquiry
